alert.note: Alert for Barry (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 10:32AM EDT until April 11 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Michigan... Thornapple River Above Hastings affecting Barry County. .One to two inches of rain has fallen during the past 36 hours and will take a few days to flow from tributaries into the river. Generally dry weather is expected during the next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Thornapple River Above Hastings. * WHEN...Until Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Expect major flooding of River Road, farmland, and homes in low lying areas adjacent to the river. Over 200 homes flooded in the Hastings area and homes flood in Nashville on Water Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM EDT Thursday was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet on 05/19/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
